startMessage:
You have just finished your last final at the CBTF, a day later than the official last day of finals,
since you overslept and your teacher gave you a retake. Not a single student in sight, the campus feels very quiet. TOO quiet...
Suddenly a scurry of squirrels appears in the distance. They look feral, teeth bared, frothing at the mouth. Luckily, they have not noticed you yet.
You must act quick, and escape the campus before you are devoured!
deathMessage: GAME OVER. You have died from your injuries!

itemTypes.itemDescription: Baseball Bat - Reduces the threat level in an area to zero. Item breaks after use.
MedKit - Reduces your injury level to zero.
Bus Key - A peculiarly shaped key that seems to be for starting a bus.

areas.description:
You are on the Bardeen Quad. The trees around Boneyard Creek are teeming with squirrels.
The only paths out appear to be NORTH through Grainger towards the ECEB building, and SOUTH across the bridge towards Green St. and the Union.

You approach the ECEB building. A foul smell emanates from within.
Luckily, the stench seems to have kept the squirrels out of this area, for now. There are two paths from here:
EAST towards the Siebel Center, or SOUTH to the Bardeen Quad.

You arrive at the snazzy-looking Siebel Center for CS. There are few squirrels in the area,
but the abundance of trees for them to hide in does not bode well. Best to leave soon.
Either WEST towards the ECEB or SOUTH towards Loomis.

As you near Loomis, you are reminded of the awful experiences you had in the physics classes there.
Although there are no squirrels here, you still get the urge to leave quickly.
You can go NORTH towards the Siebel Center or SOUTH towards the ISR.

The usually bustling ISR is eerily quiet. You hear movement in the trees, but cannot see who or what it came from.
There remains few supplies in the dining hall, and even fewer at Terrabyte.
Going forth, you have the option of NORTH towards Loomis or SOUTH towards Krannert.

The massive structure of the Krannert Performing Arts Center is surrounded by many trees, and with them, plenty of menacing squirrels.
You should run soon. Your options are NORTH to the ISR, SOUTH to Allen Hall, or WEST to the Main Quad.

The Illini Union appears, next to a quiet Green Street. You look south towards the Main Quad and see an empty,
desolate swath of the area laid waste by the squirrel menace. You can either return NORTH to the Bardeen Quad,
or venture SOUTH towards the scorched Main Quad.

At the Main Quad, you marvel in wonder at the sudden emergence of Oak saplings in the ground. A few squirrels gaze at you from afar
but none dare attack you, yet. From here, you can wander NORTH towards the Union,
EAST towards Krannert, SOUTH towards the Foellinger Auditorium, or further WEST to the Transit Plaza Bus Station

Hoping to find some supplies, you enter the bookstore. However, as soon as you enter, you are AMBUSHED by a scurry of squirrels!!!
You see a strange glistening key in the corner of the bookstore, but you will almost certainly get attacked if you stay.
You can only go EAST back towards Transit Plaza. Hurry!!

Approaching Transit Plaza, you notice a bus has broken down, long since abandoned. Maybe you could do something with it if you had a key.
Regardless, the paths from here lead only WEST, inside the bookstore, or back EAST towards the Main Quad.

The round shape of the Foellinger Auditorium comes into view. The steps leading inside seem chipped away by some powerful force. You do not dare go inside.
Instead, you choose between the NORTH direction of the Main Quad, or the direction SOUTH towards the South Quad.

Gazing around the South Quad, you notice the once beautiful area is riddled with acorns. A few squirrels guard the bigger piles,
but do not seem to want to risk losing their stash attacking you. From here, you may go NORTH
towards Foellinger, or EAST where the tennis courts are.

You approach the tennis courts apprehensively, closely watching the surrounding trees for movement.
A bat-shaped tennis racquet lies on the ground. Back WEST lies the South Quad, and further SOUTH you can see the FAR dorms jutting out into the sky.

WOAH THERE! You nearly scream as you notice a scurry of squirrels coming together to form a much larger mass only 10 feet ahead, near the entrance to Allen Hall.
A shiny object catches your eye, but if you stay here, death is imminent! You can only find an escape back NORTH towards Krannert.

The tall, green twin dorms of the Florida Avenue come before you. The end seems to be in sight, as you realize you can escape
just ahead if you make it to the Horse farm. You can either double back NORTH towards the Tennis Courts
or attempt escape SOUTH to the Horse Farm.

You've finally made it. The Horse Farm comes into view, and with it a group of horses.
Not only are there no trees to provide cover for stalking squirrels, but you can safely saddle a horse
and make your way home. As you ride into the sunset, you feel a sudden dread as you remember
you left your laptop in your dorm!
